dmca.title: Author wonders why takedown takes time
dmca.body:
On May 10, I faxed a Notice of Infringement to Blogger regarding this URL:

http://outside-the-asylum.blogspot.com/2005/05/abc-says-rumsfeld-holding-fallen-idol.html

It was originally published at:

http://www.spoofnews.com/content/view/229/31/

I sent the original to Blogger by FedEx. It arrived on May 16. According to
FedEx records, it was signed for by "[private]." The Proof of Delivery is
attached.

This morning, I noticed that the material is still posted on Blogger. I know
that several other people have complained about the site's stated policy of
being "one-half plagiarized." I believe this incident is especially blatant
because a 675+ word article was posted, and a comment giving me credit and a
link back to the article was deleted by the offending party.

I believe this is a violation of the Blogspot.com Terms of Service, Section
4, second paragraph, point e. I request that this material be removed
immediately.

I have not gotten a response about the Notice of Infringement. When can I
expect a reply?

Thank you.

John Burgund
